column4: I have totem, xmms, vlc, gxine..non of them are supporting wma or wmv
I have totem, xmms, vlc, gxine..non of them are supporting wma or wmv
did you install the proper codcs
i have w32codecs installed and they all play for me
i dont know about WMV, but wma should be working properly
those two formats are particularly 'pretty' in linux ( microsoft designed it to be this way)
check the forums out there might be more info
you might want to look at this too: http://blogs.linux.ie/xeer/2005/08/16/how-to-convert-from-wma-to-mp3/
you can get mplayer from the repositories
hehe you got alot to learn : ) the repos have thousands of software packages that you can just search through
once you figure it out its amazing though : )
wiki.ubuntu.com has a TON of great info it can answer 80% of ALL questions
you might want to try easyubuntu , it will install a LOT of packages you will probraly want/like
after adding multiverse, search for mplayer
